Legit, I'm afraid of gene editing. I was born with multiple disabilities, and if I believe in the kind of God that could do this, and God 'himself" came down from the clouds and offered to take all my disabilities away, I'd tell "him" to get lost. I Am who I Am, after all. Disability pride, WOOT! Rather than editing us out of existence, which, come on, we all know that's among the first goals, society would be a lot better if it just topped discriminating against people in general. Thing is, even if you eliminate ALL of your so-called problems, you'll pick new things to be problems. It's just how the brain works. This is a relativist talking, mind you, but can you really grasp happy without sad, and so forth?
